@graph.caption: Vegan Chocolate Chip Cake Recipe. This Chocolate Chip Quick Bread is super easy and popular to everyone. Add seasonal berries, make cupcakes, add a streusel for variation. #Vegan #Soyfree #Nutfree #Recipe GF option #veganricha | VeganRicha.com

@graph.name: Vegan Chocolate Chip Cake Recipe - Vegan Richa
@graph.description: Vegan Chocolate Chip Cake Recipe. Easy Chocolate Chip Quick Bread. Add seasonal berries, make cupcakes, add a streusel for variation Soyfree Nutfree GF option

@graph.name: Vegan Chocolate Chip Cake Recipe
@graph.description: Vegan Chocolate Chip Cake Recipe. This Chocolate Chip Quick Bread is super easy and popular to everyone. Add seasonal berries, make cupcakes, add a streusel for variation. Vegan Soyfree Nutfree Recipe
recipeIngredient: 1 cup non dairy milk (, such as almond or soy)
1 tbsp non dairy yogurt or applesauce or more non dairy milk
1 tsp apple cider vinegar (or other vinegar)
1/3 cup unrefined sugar (, use 1 tbsp more for sweeter)
1/4 cup oil (neutral such as organic safflower or canola) (or use 3 tbsp applesauce to make oil-free)
a few drops of almond extract (, optional but wonderful)
2 cups of flour ((I use a mix of unbleached all purpose(1.25 cups) and wheat(3/4 cup))
1/2 cup vegan chocolate chips (, I like a mix of mini and regular size vegan chocolate chips/chunks/chopped up dark chocolate)

recipeInstructions.text: Line a 9 by 5 inch or smaller loaf pan with parchment or grease well. Preheat the oven to 360 deg F (182 deg C). In a bowl, mix in the wet ingredients until the sugar is fully combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Line a 9 by 5 inch or smaller loaf pan with parchment or grease well. Preheat the oven to 360 deg F (182 deg C). In a bowl, mix in the wet ingredients until the sugar is fully combined.

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl, whisk 1 3/4 cup flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Add spices of choice if you like. See GF option in Notes below. (Optional: Add 2 tbsp almond flour to the dry for additional texture). At this point you can also toss in seasonal berries of choice.
recipeInstructions.name: In another bowl, whisk 1 3/4 cup flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Add spices of choice if you like. See GF option in Notes below. (Optional: Add 2 tbsp almond flour to the dry for additional texture). At this point you can also toss in seasonal berries of choice.

recipeInstructions.text: Fold the dry into the wet until just about combined. Add more flour if needed 1 tbsp at a time to make just slightly thick batter (you might not need any depending on the flours used).
recipeInstructions.name: Fold the dry into the wet until just about combined. Add more flour if needed 1 tbsp at a time to make just slightly thick batter (you might not need any depending on the flours used).

recipeInstructions.text: Add 1/3 cup chocolate chips and mix in. Pour the batter into a prepared loaf pan. Sprinkle the remaining chocolate chips on top. or top with a streusel of choice.
recipeInstructions.name: Add 1/3 cup chocolate chips and mix in. Pour the batter into a prepared loaf pan. Sprinkle the remaining chocolate chips on top. or top with a streusel of choice.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 50 to 55 mins.  Cool for 10 mins, then remove from pan. Cool completely before slicing. Store on the counter for upto 2 days, refrigerated for upto 7 days, freeze (slices) for upto a month. See Tips above for troubleshooting.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 50 to 55 mins.  Cool for 10 mins, then remove from pan. Cool completely before slicing. Store on the counter for upto 2 days, refrigerated for upto 7 days, freeze (slices) for upto a month. See Tips above for troubleshooting.

recipeInstructions.text: To make cupcakes/muffins: Bake for 22 to 24 mins for regular size muffinsBake in a brownie pan, bake for 40 mins.
recipeInstructions.name: To make cupcakes/muffins: Bake for 22 to 24 mins for regular size muffinsBake in a brownie pan, bake for 40 mins.

@graph.keywords: chocolate chip bread, chocolate chip quick bread, vegan chocolate chip loaf
